meanings.def: used instead of someone in negative sentences and in questions after if/whether, and after verbs such as prevent, forbid, avoid, etc.
examples: Does anyone else want to come?
I forbid anyone to touch that clock.

meanings.def: any person at all; it does not matter who
examples: Anybody can see that it's wrong.
The exercises are so simple that almost anyone can do them.
She wasn't anyone before she got that job.

related: I defy you/anyone to do something
